title: Two Boston startups join the race to create the next major weight-loss drug
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Vivtex partners with Novo Nordisk to develop oral obesity drugs, potentially earning $2.1 billion in royalties.
Nimbus Therapeutics partners with Eli Lilly on oral obesity treatment, with the deal potentially worth up to $1.3 billion.
Vivtex utilizes 'GI tract on a chip' technology for rapid drug testing; Nimbus focuses on AI-driven drug discovery.

title: MBTA police seek woman who allegedly assaulted man on Green Line
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: MBTA Transit Police seek a woman who assaulted a 71-year-old man on the Green Line at Prudential station.
The suspect allegedly punched the man in the face and sprayed him with pepper spray at 3 p.m. on Feb. 17.
Authorities urge anyone with information to contact MBTA Transit Police at 617-222-1050 and may remain anonymous.

title: Monson couple in their 70s killed in three-alarm house fire
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A three-alarm house fire in Monson claimed the lives of John Lynch, 75, and Linda Lynch, 73, on February 19.
Two Monson police officers were hospitalized for smoke inhalation after attempting to rescue the couple from heavy smoke and heat.
Firefighters faced challenges with collapsed roofs and limited water supply; the fire's cause is still under investigation by authorities.

title: Roman Anthony’s take on Red Sox World Series expectations in 2026
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Roman Anthony, 21, aims for a World Series win, considering anything less a failure for the Red Sox in 2026.
The Red Sox face lineup challenges after Alex Bregman's departure, needing players like Anthony to step up offensively.
Boston holds a 15:1 outsider's chance at winning the World Series according to DraftKings, ranking seventh overall.

title: ‘Superhero’ runners to sweep through Boston Marathon’s final 17 miles
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: About 100 runners in costumes will run the last 17 miles of the Boston Marathon route on Saturday.
The SuperHero17 training run is a tribute to Susan Hurley, late founder of CharityTeams.
Runners will start in Natick and finish on Newbury Street, wearing superhero and themed costumes.

title: Should pajamas be banned at Logan Airport?
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Tampa International Airport jokingly suggested banning pajamas, sparking online debate and national media coverage.
Airport spokesperson clarified post was in jest, encouraging travelers to remain comfortable.
U.S. Department of Transportation promotes civility in travel amidst rising in-flight incidents since 2019.

title: Sullivan’s Castle Island reopens for the 2026 season
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Sullivan's Castle Island reopens on February 27, 2026, marking its 75th season despite recent severe snowfall in Boston.
The concession stand serves popular items like hot dogs from Kayem, lobster rolls, and ice cream, attracting long lines of customers.
Sullivan's operates annually from late February or early March until November, having won a James Beard America's Classics Award last year.

title: Court doc: N.H. country club shooter said he chose location to target rich people
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Hunter Nadeau, 24, charged with murder and assault for shooting at Sky Meadow Country Club, killing one person.
Nadeau allegedly targeted the club's steakhouse to 'punish the wealthy,' avoiding civilians at a nearby wedding.
The accused fired indiscriminately inside, injuring and killing patrons until being subdued by other guests.

title: Kelsey Fitzsimmons alleges former fiancé broke into her home, stole evidence while she was hospitalized
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Kelsey Fitzsimmons alleges her former fiancé stole evidence and impersonated her while she was hospitalized with postpartum depression.
Surveillance video purportedly shows ex-fiancé and three others breaking into Fitzsimmons's North Andover home on July 3, 2025.
Essex County DA declined to charge the ex-fiancé for the alleged break-in; Fitzsimmons claims prosecutorial leniency and bias against her.

title: Drake Maye hosted a free football clinic while vacationing in Hawaii
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Drake Maye hosted a free football clinic in Kealakekua, Hawaii, while on vacation, supporting local high school athletes.
The event was organized by Rich Miano and SAP, featuring 50 quarterbacks, wide receivers, and three girls flag football players.
Maye guided participants through drills on footwork, throwing mechanics, and route trees, enhancing their skills at no cost.
